subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
Tonight we’ll be broadcasting from Philadelphia, home of the Independence Hall, the Liberty
  Bell and a vibrant population that is the sixth-largest in the United States.
  Philly is also known as the city where American democracy was born –
  and tonight we’ll have a cultural and historical view of a city that
  has contributed so much to our country’s history.
 
This city, which was home to the country’s
  first hospital – founded by Benjamin Franklin in 1751 – now is
  having a health-care crunch that’s particularly acute for pregnant
  women and the care they’re getting when it counts. I’ll take a
  closer look at this story for you.
 
Before that, the news of the day. To start out our
  broadcast, David Martin will have an exclusive report on Pentagon planning
  and the war in Iraq.
  Meanwhile, are Democrats blinking first on the prospect of a withdrawal
  deadline? Sharyl Attkisson will fill you in.
 
A different kind of debate is heating up on the
  streets – and on the Web. An anti-informant “stop
  snitching” campaign now has a high-tech edge. And this is infuriating
  federal prosecutors, Bob Orr will explain.
 
As Hurricane season approaches, National Weather
  Service forecasters warn that they expect between 13 and 17 tropical storms
  this year, with at least seven of them becoming hurricanes. Is the Gulf Coast
  ready? Hari Sreenivasan will examine New
    Orleans’ levee system and whether it is
  equipped to survive a major storm.
 
We’ve been following the story of the two whales
  stranded 60 miles up the Sacramento River in California. Sandra Hughes will tell you
  about the obstacles still in their way en route to their ocean home –
  and the hope spectators have for their safe return.
 
Finally, we’ll come back to Philadelphia, where we will settle down
  with a cheesesteak and channel some memories from decades past in The City of
  Brotherly Love.
 
I hope you’ll join us.
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
